org.eng.aisp

Class SoundRecording

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eng.util.TaggedEntity
      • org.eng.aisp.LabeledDataWindow<double[]>
        • org.eng.aisp.LabeledDoubleWindow
          • org.eng.aisp.SoundRecording
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, ILabeledDataWindow<double[]>, ITaggedEntity

    public class SoundRecording
extends LabeledDoubleWindow
    Contains PCM sound data and associated labels. Extends the super class to define the data window as a SoundClip.
    Author:
    dawood
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • CLIP_FIELD_NAME

        public static final String CLIP_FIELD_NAME
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SET_DIMENSION_FROM_TYPE_PROPERTY

        public static final String SET_DIMENSION_FROM_TYPE_PROPERTY
        If set to true, then allow data-type tag of the SoundRecording object to set the dimensionality of the SoundClip provided to constructors. This may be useful when older 3-D SoundClips were saved without the dimensionality stored in the wav file. Defaults to false in which case an exception is thrown when the SoundRecording data type does not match the dimensionality of the SoundClip.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SetDimensionFromType

        public static final boolean SetDimensionFromType

      • readMetaDataSounds

        public static IShuffleIterable<SoundRecording> readMetaDataSounds(String src)
                                                           throws IOException
        Load sound files and labels from the files specified in a metadata file. A convenience on LabeledSoundFiles.loadMetaDataSounds(String, boolean). Formats supported are defined there, but include at least mp3 and wav.
        Parameters:
        src -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        IOException

      • readMetaDataSounds

        public static IShuffleIterable<SoundRecording> readMetaDataSounds(String src,
                                                                  boolean requireAllFiles)
                                                           throws IOException
        Load sound files and labels from the files specified in a metadata file. A convenience on LabeledSoundFiles.loadMetaDataSounds(String, boolean). Formats supported are defined there, but include at least mp3 and wav.
        Parameters:
        src - directory containing metadata.csv or a metadata.csv file.
        requireAllFiles - if true, then throw an exception if every sound file listed in the wav file could not be located. Otherwise, allow wav files to be missing and don't include those in the resulting iterable.
        Returns:
        never null.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • readMetaDataSounds

        public static IShuffleIterable<SoundRecording> readMetaDataSounds(String[] src)
                                                           throws IOException
        Load sound files and labels from the files specified in one or more metadata files. A convenience on LabeledSoundFiles.loadMetaDataSounds(String[], boolean). Formats supported are defined there, but include at least mp3 and wav.
        Parameters:
        src - directory containing metadata.csv or a metadata.csv file.
        Returns:
        Throws:
        IOException

                                                                  boolean requireAllFiles)

        Load sound files and labels from the files specified in one or more metadata files. A convenience on LabeledSoundFiles.loadMetaDataSounds(String[], boolean). Formats supported are defined there, but include at least mp3 and wav.
        Parameters:
        src - directory containing metadata.csv or a metadata.csv file.
        requireAllFiles - if true, then throw an exception if every sound file listed in the wav file could not be located. Otherwise, allow wav files to be missing and don't include those in the resulting iterable.
        Returns:
        never null.
        Throws:

      • readSounds

        public static IShuffleIterable<SoundRecording> readSounds(String srcDir)
                                                   throws IOException
        Load sound files and labels from the given directory and make use of a metadata.csv file if it exists to apply labels. A convenience on LabeledSoundFiles.loadSounds(String, boolean). Formats supported are defined there, but include at least mp3 and wav.
        Parameters:
        src - directory containing sounds and optionally a metadata.csv.
        Returns:
        Throws:
        IOException
        See Also:
